Package oliverl_dv22olt.robot2

Class MemoryRobot

java.lang.Object
oliverl_dv22olt.robot2.MemoryRobot
public class MemoryRobot extends Object
MemoryRobot is an implementation of a Robot where it uses a depth-first search to go solve the maze by always going to a unvisited position if possible.
If there are no adjacent positions that have not yet been visited, it will backtrack until it finds one.
Author:
Oliver Lundqvist

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final Stack<Position>
    currentPath
    A stack that the MemoryRobot uses to keep track of what path it has taken
    private final Maze

    The maze that the MemoryRobot will attempt to solve
    private Position
    position
    The current position of the MemoryRobot
    private final ArrayList<Integer>
    visitedPositions
    An ArrayList of positions that the MemoryRobot has previously visited

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MemoryRobot(Maze maze)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Position
    getPosition()
    Returns the current position of the MemoryRobot
    boolean
    hasReachedGoal()
    Checks if the MemoryRobot has reached the goal of its maze
    Will return true if a goal has been reached, otherwise false
    void
    move()
    Moves the MemoryRobot
    The robot will always choose what path to take in a pre-determined order: North, east, south then west.
    It will only move to a position it has not previously visited
    If there are no adjacent positions it has not visited, it will backtrack along its path until it finds an adjacent position that has not been visited
    private void
    setPosition(Position position)
    Sets the position of the MemoryRobot
    Will also add the new position to the visitedPositions attribute if it's not already there and will lastly add the new position to its current path

  • Constructor Details

    • MemoryRobot

      public MemoryRobot(Maze maze)

      Creates a MemoryRobot using a maze

      Parameters:
      maze - The maze that will be used to create the robot

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move()

      Moves the MemoryRobot
      The robot will always choose what path to take in a pre-determined order: North, east, south then west.
      It will only move to a position it has not previously visited
      If there are no adjacent positions it has not visited, it will backtrack along its path until it finds an adjacent position that has not been visited

    • getPosition

      public Position getPosition()

      Returns the current position of the MemoryRobot

      Returns:
      The current position

    • setPosition

      private void setPosition(Position position)

      Sets the position of the MemoryRobot
      Will also add the new position to the visitedPositions attribute if it's not already there and will lastly add the new position to its current path

      Parameters:
      position - The position to move to

    • hasReachedGoal

      public boolean hasReachedGoal()

      Checks if the MemoryRobot has reached the goal of its maze
      Will return true if a goal has been reached, otherwise false

      Returns:
      True if the MemoryRobot has reached a goal, otherwise false
